title: Support for argument of enslaved autonomy

content.question: Which of the following could best be used as evidence to support the argument in the third paragraph of the excerpt that enslaved people engaged in oppositional activities?

choices.label: Slaveholders allowed some enslaved African Americans to work unsupervised.
Enslaved African Americans routinely caused tools to break or worked more slowly as means of resistance.
Abolitionists criticized slaveholders for separating enslaved children from their parents.
Enslaved African Americans assigned to plantation homes had easier working conditions than those who worked in the fields.

content.answer: Enslaved African Americans routinely caused tools to break or worked more slowly as means of resistance.

topic.text: 4.12: African Americans in the Early Republic

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Explain how claims or evidence support, modify, or refute a source's argument.
